title: Crumbed Chicken Tenderloins (Air Fried) Recipe
description: These air fryer chicken tenderloins are easy to make with a simple egg wash and crumb-coating for tasty fried chicken that beats nuggets any day!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe:¬†Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Meat and Poultry Chicken Crumbed Chicken Tenderloins (Air Fried) 4.7 (198) 163 Reviews 29 Photos These air fryer chicken tenderloins beat chicken nuggets any day and the recipe is so simple. I tend to use chicken tenderloins but you can use sliced chicken breasts if easier. Submitted by Launa Updated on November 17, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 29 29 29 29 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 8 tenderloins Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 large egg ¬Ω cup dry bread crumbs 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 8 chicken tenderloins Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Preheat an air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Whisk egg in a small bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix bread crumbs and oil together in a second bowl until mixture becomes loose and crumbly. Dip each chicken tenderloin into the bowl of egg; shake off any residual egg. Dip chicken into crumb mixture, making sure it is evenly and fully covered. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Lay chicken tenderloins in the air fryer basket in an even layer. Air-fry until no longer pink in the center, about 12 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve hot and enjoy! Allrecipes Magazine Recipe Tip You can substitute butter for the vegetable oil if desired. I Made It Print 279 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 253 Calories 11g Fat 10g Carbs 26g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 253 % Daily Value * Total Fat 11g 15% Saturated Fat 2g 12% Cholesterol 109mg 36% Sodium 171mg 7% Total Carbohydrate 10g 4% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 1g Protein 26g 52% Calcium 42mg 3% Iron 2mg 9% Potassium 231mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Crumbed Chicken Tenderloins (Air Fried) 01 of 29 Photo by¬† Allrecipes Magazine 02 of 29 Photo by¬† Loves2cook 08/27/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Family favorite WOW what a Game Changer! For 2 reasons. FIRST it was so quick and easy and absolutely delicious. We followed the directions exactly. The tenders we had weighed 1.16 lbs which ended up yielding 7 tenders. SECOND Mixing the oil with the breadcrumbs was ABSOLUTE GENIUS. No need for double dipping as the breadcrumbs stayed perfectly on the tenders. We will be using that method from now on. We made these again but this time we tweaked the spices to our southern taste buds. To the breadcrumbs we added 1t Cayenne Pepper 1/2t Garlic Powder with 1/2t Spanish Paprika and mixed all together then instead of vegetable oil we like to use Avocado oil. Our Air Frier is small so we could only get 3 tenders at a time. When we got to the last tender we turned the temperature down to 375¬∞ and cooked it for 10 minutes and then flipped for another 10 minutes. That seems to be the best temperature and time in our Air Fryer. No 2 Air Fryer‚Äôs are the same from what we are hearing. The next batch we make we will try 1 1/2t of Cayenne Pepper or try adding 1 1/2t of FRANKS to the egg. For dipping we had 2 sauces. One was Ranch and the other was FRANKS mixed with Plain Greek Yogurt. As you can see we served them with Grilled Corn and a Garden fresh salad with a few shakes of Organic Herbs De Provence, Either way LAUNA we can‚Äôt thank you enough for sharing your recipe with us. What a Great Low Carb recipe.Thanks again LOVES2COOK. 03 of 29 Photo by¬† DaCook 10/26/2023 Easy and Tasty! I added to the shrimp and pasta. Thank you! 04 of 29 Photo by¬† Holly G 08/21/2023 This was fantastic! An easy and quick recipe for a weeknight dinner! Pro tip: I added a couple of tablespoons of grated Parmesan cheese to the bread crumbs for extra zing! Delicious! 05 of 29 Photo by¬† Margie Diane Sanfilippo 07/15/2023 This is a great basic recipe for chicken strips/nuggets. How you season it is up to you. I used Italian bread crumbs and added some cayenne pepper. Eight breasts, though? In my tiny air fryer, that would have taken me all night! I only did three breasts and for that, I had to double the recipe. Not sure how you would bread eight breasts with just one egg!LOL: edit here, it's supposed to be eight TENDERLOINS, not breasts! That's ok--we ate them all! 06 of 29 Photo by¬† HeartyHam9841 02/01/2023 I liked this recipe (of course I added my own spices after reading other reviews. I used1 1/2 cups Panko bread crumbs. Added 1/2 cup brown sugar and 2 tsp Ground Red Cayenne Pepper. I will have to say‚Ä¶DELICIOUS üòãI baked these lower in the oven on 400 for 25 mins turned them half way thru. Try it!! 07 of 29 Photo by¬† MountainLovinGal 01/08/2023 Super easy recipe and it turned out perfectly. I used a Costco bag of tenderloins, so I doubled the recipe. My family likes it spicy, so to the doubled recipe, I added: 1 tsp of Poultry Seasoning, 1 tsp of garlic powder, 1/4 tsp of Cayenne, 1/4 tsp salt, and a generous amount of fresh ground pepper. As others have said, don't crowd your basket, and 6 minutes, then flip is perfect. Absolutely tender, tasty, and yum! 08 of 29 Photo by¬† kcarpenterhawaii 01/03/2022 09 of 29 Photo by¬† Casablancaise 10/08/2021 10 of 29 Photo by¬† Scott Thomas 06/04/2020 This was my first time making this recipe and it came out FANTASTIC! The tenders were perfectly cooked and the breading was as crunchy as could be! I used my favorite Honky Tonk Heat sauce as a dipping sauce and it provided the perfect kick! Highly recommend! 1 2 3 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Air Fryer Cornflake-Crusted Chicken Tenders 9 Ratings Air Fryer Keto Chicken Wings 6 Ratings Air Fryer Korean Fried Chicken 2 Ratings Air Fryer Popcorn-Crusted Popcorn Chicken Air Fryer Chicken Thighs 172 Ratings Air Fryer Chicken Thigh Schnitzel 17 Ratings Honey Glazed Chicken 558 Ratings BBQ Chicken Pouches 5 Ratings A Good, Easy Garlic Chicken 1,761 Ratings Simple Lemon Chicken 19 Ratings Blackened Ranch Pan-Fried Chicken Thighs 15 Ratings Lemon Pepper Chicken I 91 Ratings Air Fryer Chile Verde Burritos 1 Rating Crispy Chicken Tenders 3 Ratings Golden Air-Fried Chicken Tenders Easy Baked Chicken Tenders 75 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family. name: Launa
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Preheat an air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Whisk egg in a small bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Mix bread crumbs and oil together in a second bowl until mixture becomes loose and crumbly.;Dip each chicken tenderloin into the bowl of egg; shake off any residual egg. Dip chicken into crumb mixture, making sure it is evenly and fully covered. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Lay chicken tenderloins in the air fryer basket in an even layer.;Air-fry until no longer pink in the center, about 12 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Serve hot and enjoy! Allrecipes Magazine
